channel.description: Recent content in Service Management Automation on PowerShell Magazine | For the most powerful community

item.title: Why you should install WMF 5.0 Production Preview on your SMA runbook workers
item.description: Although it is not officially supported yet, here is why you should install WMF 5.0 Production Preview on your runbook workers right now!

item.title: #PSTip Be cautious with profile customizations and PowerShell Workflow
item.description: When working with Windows PowerShell Workflow, there are things to be aware of which can break workflow from working. One such thing is customizations made in the PowerShell profile.

item.title: Introduction to Service Management Automation
item.description: Service Management Automation (SMA) is a new component in System Center for process automation. Before looking into the technical details, let’s have a look at what practical use cases there are for an automation product like SMA:

item.title: Using PowerShell Switch vs. Boolean Parameters in SMA Runbooks
item.description: Hey Readers. In this article, I wanted to take the opportunity to talk about a scenario that may be “edge case” but a case just the same within the constructs of leveraging switch parameters in PowerShell workflow.
